univie.cs.pps
Class PPSSetup

java.lang.Object
  univie.cs.pps.PPSSetup

public class PPSSetup
extends Object

The PPSSetup class is used by PPSSimulator and PPSPeer to create the Pastry environment, boot the nodes, and observe the results.

Author:
Dario Seidl

Constructor Summary
PPSSetup()
          Creates an environment for using the simulator.
PPSSetup(Integer randomSeed)
          Creates an environment for using the simulator, with a fixed random seed.

          Creates an environment for using the network.

Constructor Detail

PPSSetup

public PPSSetup()
Creates an environment for using the simulator.

PPSSetup

public PPSSetup(Integer randomSeed)
Creates an environment for using the simulator, with a fixed random seed.

Parameters:
randomSeed - if not null or 0, use this as the random seed for the simulator. In that case the results will always be the same.

PPSSetup

public PPSSetup(String bootAddress,
                int bootPort,
                int bindPort)
         throws IOException
Creates an environment for using the network.

Parameters:
bootAddress - the IP address of the boot node.
bootPort - the port of the boot node.
bindPort - the port to bind for this node. In case multiple nodes are booted by this class, this port will be used for the first node, and incremented by 1 for each node thereafter.
Throws:
IOException - If the bootAddress cannot be parsed or the construction of the SocketPastryNodeFactory fails.
Method Detail

addVariation

public static void addVariation(double v)
Used to keep track of value variations from the GaussianValueReader objects, for logging and plotting.

scheduleJoiningNodes

public void scheduleJoiningNodes(long period,
                                 int nodes,
                                 ValueReaderFactory valueReaderFactory,
                                 int stepSize,
                                 int updateInterval,
                                 double min,
                                 double max,
                                 boolean traceMessages,
                                 TimerTask doAfter)
Creates new nodes and boot them into the ring.

Parameters:
period - the time to wait between creating each new node.
nodes - the number of new nodes.
valueReaderFactory - a ValueReaderFactory that creates ValueReader instances for the new nodes.
stepSize - the time between sending messages to the node to signal the start of the next step in the Push-Sum protocol.
updateInterval - the number of steps between updating node values. If set to 0, the node values will never be updated.
min - the domain-specific minimum possible value, used as a lower bound for the estimates.
max - the domain-specific maximum possible value, used as an upper bound for the estimates.
traceMessages - if set to @code true}, the new nodes will log all sent and received messages.
doAfter - a TimerTask to execute after all nodes have been booted.

scheduleJoiningNodes

public void scheduleJoiningNodes(long period,
                                 ValueReaderFactory valueReaderFactory,
                                 int stepSize,
                                 int updateInterval,
                                 double min,
                                 double max,
                                 boolean traceMessages)
Periodically creates new nodes and boot them into the ring.

Parameters:
period - the time to wait between creating each new node.
valueReaderFactory - a ValueReaderFactory that creates ValueReader instances for the new nodes.
stepSize - the time between sending messages to the node to signal the start of the next step in the Push-Sum protocol.
updateInterval - the number of steps between updating node values. If set to 0, the node values will never be updated.
min - the minimum possible value, used as a lower bound for the estimates.
max - the maximum possible value, used as an upper bound for the estimates.
traceMessages - if set to true, the new nodes will log all sent and received messages.

scheduleLeavingNodes

public void scheduleLeavingNodes(long period)
Periodically tells a random node to stop participating.

scheduleReset

public void scheduleReset(long period)
Broadcast a message from the first node to all nodes, initiating a reset of the Push-Sum protocol.

scheduleObservation

public void scheduleObservation(long delay,
                                long period,
                                int verbosity)
Schedules a task for logging.

Parameters:
delay - Time before the task is run for the first time.
period - Interval between subsequent invocations.

scheduleTermination

public void scheduleTermination(long delay)
Destroys the environment after the given delay.

Parameters:
delay - the time before the environment is destroyed.

getEnvironment

public Environment getEnvironment()
Returns the Pastry Environment.
